result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Timothy E Capitonoff in court, in custody, with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #15CF420.

Defendant Timothy E Capitonoff in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario requests an adjournment so he can try to obtain a global offer on all cases.  Court adjourns.  Court addresses WCS letter.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding WCS letter.  Court orders Defendant to report to WCS immediately after court to test.  WCS to report results to court TODAY.    Bail remains as fixed.

Defendant Timothy E Capitonoff in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario requests an adjourned date for jury status and jury trial on Case #15CF420.  This case is adjourned to jury status date on that case.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Timothy E Capitonoff in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Timothy E Capitonoff did not appear.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario believes that Defendant did not know he had to appear today due to confusion with his felony case.    Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Timothy E Capitonoff in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to see public defender as he may be losing his job.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Timothy E Capitonoff in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
